comments:
I am attempting to create a local mirror of the 3.2 Update site via the 
command line options of the update manager. org.eclipse.rcp, 
org.eclipse.platform and org.eclipse.sdk all fail to be mirrored, the latter 
two I think because they have org.eclipse.rcp as a sub-feature, which fails 
to mirror. (the remainder of the features successfully mirror)

I thus attempted to mirror just org.eclipse.rcp. It gets up to copying the 
plugin archives then fails with a 404 error (log below). There's a few bugs 
lodged about the processing of pack.gz files but nothing that mentioned a 
mirror of org.eclipse.rcp not working. I manually entered the failing URL in 
my browser to ensure I wasn't somehow using a faulty mirror, but it failed 
as well.

In searching for equivalent bugs, bug 149415 looked to be similar.

I am using Eclipse 3.2 and the Sun 1.5 JVM on a Windows XP platform to do the mirroring.

Thanks
Michael

This also occurs when you use the IDE or standaloneUpdate to check for updates to eclipse 3.2.  

The message is written to the .log in both cases, although the IDE successfully reports "no updates available...please try again later" as normal.

!MESSAGE Digest could not be parsed:Unable to retrieve remote reference "http://download.eclipse.org/updates/3.2/digest.zip". [Server returned HTTP response code: "404 Not Found" for URL: http://download.eclipse.org/updates/3.2/digest.zip.]

The correct url for the digest should be update.eclipse.org/updates/3.2/digest.zip

I recommend you post this question on the newsgroup.

Reassigning to the platform team.

-M

Hi Denis,
Digest url is specified on digestURL attribute in site tag of site.xml. It is actually the directory of digest.zip so if for instance you specify digestURL="mysite.com/update" will will attemp to access mysite.com/update/digest.zip. I looked into http://download.eclipse.org/updates/3.2/site.xml and digestURL is set to:
http://download.eclipse.org/updates/3.2/ not http://update.eclipse.org/updates/3.2/digest.zip
This looks like a problem on your side. Please reclaim the bug.

The webmaster doesn't control site.xml.  I've asked the releng team to take a look, perhaps this should also be reassigned to them?

-M.

My bug appears to have been hijacked somewhat here - its about the inability to mirror the update site, not the URL for the digest file. I'm assuming the digest problem does not affect the ability to mirror the update site - granted it needs to be fixed but perhaps it should be a separate bug.

My aim is to establish a mirror of the 3.2 update site behind our firewall and at the moment the ?bug I lodged is preventing us from doing so. 

Based on the wiki documentation at http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Update_Site_Optimization (maybe no pack200 means no looking for .pakc.gz files), I thought I'd try using a 1.4.2_09 Sun JVM instead, but the effect was the same (see log below). 

Is the standaloneUpdate perhaps assuming that because the pack200 attribute is true, it should always find both the .jar and the .jar.pack.gz files and mirror both?

If the problem is a bug, could the .pack.gz files be added to the site in the interim to allow the mirror to succeed?

Thanks

Per comment #4, I've modified the digestUrl value to http://update.eclipse.org/updates/3.2/digest.zip.  It should be replicated to download in the next hour or so.

The digestURL still isn't correct. I now get the following error 

!ENTRY org.eclipse.update.core 4 0 2006-07-26 13:07:12.720
!MESSAGE Digest could not be parsed:Unable to retrieve remote reference "http://download.eclipse.org/updates/3.2/digest.zip/digest.zip". [Server returned HTTP response code: "404 Not Found" for URL: http://download.eclipse.org/updates/3.2/digest.zip/digest.zip.]

If I understand the comments to this bug the digestURL should be 

digestURL="http:/update.eclipse.org/updates/3.2"

rather than 

digestURL="http://download.eclipse.org/updates/3.2/digest.zip"

as it is now.
Sonia, what would be appropriate inbox for this bug? I can't see a reason why this bug would be assigned to update inbox.
Branko, the email address wasn't changed when the produce and component were. I've fixed it.
I think this bug can be closed.

While the digestURL attribute in site.xml at update.eclipse.org/updates/3.2 looks to be fixed, the original reason for opening this bug still persists - namely that I cannot mirror the platform update site. The log shows three errors - an XML processing problem, a reference to a non-existent digest file at download.eclipse.org, and most importantly for me, the aborting of the mirror due to non-existence of a solaris related .pack.gz file.

I have thus reopened this bug. The log from my last attempt follows :-

I've got the mirror to ignore the org.eclipse.swt.gtk.solaris.x86_3.2.0.HEAD.jar.pack.gz plugin using the ignoreMissingPlugins switch, and managed to get the platform site to mirror correctly.

There are still warnings being reported with regard to the digest file as it has been renamed again in the site.xml file for some reason.

This bug can be closed.
